Let $\mathcal{A}$ be a . Let $R_{\sigma}(a)$ denote the spectral radius
of the element $a \in \mathcal{A}$.

[**Theorem -**]{} For every $a \in \mathcal{A}$ we have that
$\|a\| = \sqrt{R_{\sigma}(a^*a)}$.

This result shows that the norm in a $C^*$-algebra has a purely nature.
Moreover, the norm in a $C^*$-algebra is unique (in the sense that there
is no other norm for which the algebra is a $C^*$-algebra).
